summary: A book about how to avoid the Coronavirus

11.an: Nomás te cal entender UNA cosa sobre cómo CORRE un coronavirus
11.en: There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus

12.an: Nomás te cal entender UNA cosa sobre cómo CORRE un coronavirus
12.en: There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus

27.an: Lo virus corre quan estas gotichonas

28.an: Lo virus corre quan estas gotichonas

29.an: Queda-te leixos. A dos metros serás a salvo d’as gotetas mas grans
29.en: Keep your distance.﻿2m will keep you safe from large droplets.

30.an: Queda-te leixos. A dos metros serás a salvo d’as gotetas mas grans
30.en: Keep your distance.﻿2m will keep you safe from large droplets.

37.an: Per ixo, si veyes a belún que ye tusindo / estarnudando / malaudo
37.en: So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:

38.an: Per ixo, si veyes a belún que ye tusindo / estarnudando / malaudo
38.en: So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:

39.an: Da-les una careta. Pueden tusir u estarnudar en ella y protechen a totz los d’alredor.
39.en: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby.

40.an: Da-les una careta. Pueden tusir u estarnudar en ella y protechen a totz los d’alredor.
40.en: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby.

47.an: Talment no siga malauda, nomás ye protechendo-se
47.en: Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself

48.an: Talment no siga malauda, nomás ye protechendo-se
48.en: Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself

49.an: Las personas infectadas puede que no amuestren simptomas, pero son igualment infecciosas
49.en: People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious

50.an: Las personas infectadas puede que no amuestren simptomas, pero son igualment infecciosas
50.en: People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious

51.an: Y en cheneral, s’ha de privar qualsequier aglomeración de chent, perque no sabes quí puede estar malaudo.
51.en: And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.

52.an: Y en cheneral, s’ha de privar qualsequier aglomeración de chent, perque no sabes quí puede estar malaudo.
52.en: And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.

67.an: Y mesmo l’exterior d’a tuya careta
67.en: & even on the outside of your face mask

68.an: Y mesmo l’exterior d’a tuya careta
68.en: & even on the outside of your face mask

79.an: Manimenos, la saliva d’una persona malauda puede arribar ta atras cosas…
79.en: However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…

80.an: Manimenos, la saliva d’una persona malauda puede arribar ta atras cosas…
80.en: However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…

83.an: u la cara d’o tuyo amor

84.an: u la cara d’o tuyo amor

87.an: Y si tocas qualsequiera d’estas cosas per accident y dimpués te tocas la cara
87.en: And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,

88.an: Y si tocas qualsequiera d’estas cosas per accident y dimpués te tocas la cara
88.en: And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,

89.an: y la sola manera efectiva de librar-nos d’ells ye limpiar-los con sabón, leixiva u alcol
89.en: and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.

90.an: y la sola manera efectiva de librar-nos d’ells ye limpiar-los con sabón, leixiva u alcol
90.en: and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.

91.an: Los virus pueden permaneixer bellas quantas horas en os obchectos
91.en: Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,

92.an: Los virus pueden permaneixer bellas quantas horas en os obchectos
92.en: Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,

97.an: Per ixo, ye bueno que sigamos estes
97.en: Which is why it is also good to follow these

98.an: Per ixo, ye bueno que sigamos estes
98.en: Which is why it is also good to follow these

99.en: wash with soap up to here

100.en: wash with soap up to here

105.an: No te toques la cara. (Ni toques la cara d’otri). Si l’has de fer, lava-te antes las mans concienzudament con sabón.
105.en: Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.

106.an: No te toques la cara. (Ni toques la cara d’otri). Si l’has de fer, lava-te antes las mans concienzudament con sabón.
106.en: Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.

107.an: Lo que cuesta cantar dos vegadas “Bufa ixas velas!”
107.en: Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice

108.an: Lo que cuesta cantar dos vegadas “Bufa ixas velas!”
108.en: Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice

115.an: lava lo dorso d’as tuyas mans
115.en: wash the back of your hands

116.an: lava lo dorso d’as tuyas mans
116.en: wash the back of your hands

119.an: Si lo fas, no te’n fagas. Lava-te las mans con sabón chusto dimpuesas.
119.en: If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.

120.an: Si lo fas, no te’n fagas. Lava-te las mans con sabón chusto dimpuesas.
120.en: If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.

121.an: Mira de no tocar tampoco l’exterior d’a careta
121.en: Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.

122.an: Mira de no tocar tampoco l’exterior d’a careta
122.en: Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.

125.an: *Las bacterias creixerán endentro si portas la careta masiau tiempo
125.en: *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long

126.an: *Las bacterias creixerán endentro si portas la careta masiau tiempo
126.en: *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long

127.an: Tira la careta malas que la notes puerca. No en portes una per mas d’un día.
127.en: Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!

128.an: Tira la careta malas que la notes puerca. No en portes una per mas d’un día.
128.en: Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!

137.an: Cadaún ha de tener la suya propia tovalla

138.an: Cadaún ha de tener la suya propia tovalla

139.an: No compartas comida, cubiertos, tazas, tovallas.
139.en: Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.

140.an: No compartas comida, cubiertos, tazas, tovallas.
140.en: Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.

141.an: No te toques la cara con o codo, ni anque l’intentes
141.en: You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried

142.an: No te toques la cara con o codo, ni anque l’intentes
142.en: You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried

143.an: Siempre que puedas, ubre y zarra las puertas con os tuyos ancons u huembros en cuenta de con as mans.
143.en: Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.

144.an: Siempre que puedas, ubre y zarra las puertas con os tuyos ancons u huembros en cuenta de con as mans.
144.en: Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.

147.an: y dimpués d’estar difuera de casa
147.en: and after being out in the public

148.an: y dimpués d’estar difuera de casa
148.en: and after being out in the public

151.an: Lava-te siempre las mans con sabón…
151.en: Always wash your hands with soap…

152.an: Lava-te siempre las mans con sabón…
152.en: Always wash your hands with soap…

163.an: Leye los articlos pa mas consellos!
163.en: Read the articles for more tips!

164.an: Leye los articlos pa mas consellos!
164.en: Read the articles for more tips!
